topic.title: File tokenizer output
topic.text:
Edit: Canvas won't let me make that file public, so use this link instead: http://www.mediafire.com/file/sg6014qv1er3u1k/ftk_output_clean.txt

https://canvas.pasadena.edu/files/62471881/download?download_frd=1

This is for FTokenizer::MAX_BLOCK = STokenizer::MAX_BUFFER = 1000.

If you want to diff your output against it, use this test function:

void test_f_tokenize_simple(){
    Token t;
    const char* path = "solitude.txt";
    FTokenizer ftk(path);
    ftk >> t;
    int token_count = 0;
    while (ftk.more()){
        if (t.type_string()=="ALPHA" ){
            token_count++;
            cout << setw(10) << right <<token_count
                 << setw(3) << left << ":" << setw(25) << left << t.token_str()
                 << t.type_string() << setw(20) << right << t.token_str().length() << endl;
        }
        ftk >> t;
    }
    cout << "Tokens Found: " << token_count << endl;
}

There should be 147555 tokens.

All non-ASCII characters are treated as unknown tokens. This includes single-byte ANSI accent characters as well as multi-byte Unicode accent characters. So a lot of names/words have had characters removed and may be split into multiple ALPHA tokens.
